attributes.action: Give Gay Men the Right to Donate Blood
attributes.additional_details: Today, I visited a blood donor centre where as a gay man, I was unable to donate because I have had sexual contact within last 12 months. How ludicrous. A gay man in a committed relationship will also be unable to give blood as "gays are statistically at higher risk of being infected by HIV" ever thought that this could be because there is a lower population of gay men than heterosexual?  A heterosexual person can go on a "lively holiday" and have sexual contact on various occasions than come home and donate blood.. But a committed homosexual can't. This needs sorting, and now. It's discrimination. Straight people can contract HIV too.
